availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Sims (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Elizabeth Davenport Sims. Father of James G. Sims, Nancy C. Sims, Martha V. Sims, Salithas A. Sims, and John E. Sims. Farmer in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 26, 1863 to October 26, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 552.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Precinct 2, p. 451B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 305.
Find A Grave, "Andrew Jackson Sims (May 12, 1824-December 31, 1900)," Memorial #6982463, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6982463 (accessed March 14, 2017).
